column4: can someone help me please, i just installed linux on a partition, i have windows xp on the other, and when i try to view files from the other partition, it says that im not the owner
fstab?
/etc/fstab (file system table) defines how your windows partition is read. That link https://wiki.ubuntu.com/AutomaticallyMountMSWindowsPartitions explains a lot
you need help with fixing your /etc/fstab?
ok. start with Applications->Accessories-Terminal from the top menu bar
did that open a window for you?
good. That's the place you're going to type nearly everything someone says here.
the first thing we're going to do is make a copy of the filesystem table so if everything goes tits up, we can recover :)
in that terminal, type cp /etc/fstab ~
yes it did. if you type ls in the terminal, you should see fstab listed (ls is the same as dir in windows)
now, type gksudo gedit /etc/fstab in the terminal , it should open a file and show you some text,
those are warnings, not errors. no sweat
close it then. samuli he's using gksudo
good, work from there
no, open a firefox browser window to http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/ and copy the text to that web page, and submit it. That way we can see what your /etc/fstab is
that no after your name should have been now :)
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/14105 Do you see the addition I made, to line 6?
make the changes to the fstab in gedit, and save it
now close gedit
now, type this exactly: sudo umount /dev/sda1 && sudo mount /dev/sda1
thanks
by installing wine, which is ' wine is not a windows emulator ' :)
some, no promises
